text: On November 27, 2005, West Coast Place Playground was opened to the public by the then Member of Parliament for Ayer Rajah SMC, Dr. Tan Cheng Bock as part of the upgrading project for the residents of West Coast Gardens. There is a plague that commemorates that auspicious eventful day as one sits in a sheltered gazebo with two large-size white-picket picnic tables. There is an open-air gymnasium to workout in the open space under hot sun and a huge playground for the kids to enjoy a great play date with friends and families.

At 8.27pm 4.5.22, this playground park is in total darkness. Why are the lights not switched on? Aren't they sensor controlled? Danger lurks for one who walks through it. Parallel to the park, weeks ago on 26.4.22, it was total darkness also at the Drive road as ALL the lights lining both sides of this road blacked out from the junction with the main road right through the whole length of Drive. So dark it was that a sense of danger popped up as one walked through to the destination at the other end. ðŸ˜©

It's now been beautifully decorated ahead of National Day.

This review is only on the kids play area. (With the swing and slides).
The facility is ageing. Some areas of the rubber floor is wearing off, spewing shreds of flakes around - which is quite a hazardous condition for the children.
Not the best lighting post sunset, which also needs sprucing up for safety of park goers.
There are child care centres close to this park, so an upgrade could really benefit the community.
A newly renovated playground for children. Children can play swing, slide, and run, cycle inside the playground. With big old trees, the playground is well sheltered
Lovely little park with playground. Love it. Peaceful and serene.
